member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.AxisBetweenCategories

member.remarks: This property applies only to category axes, and it doesn't apply to 3-D charts.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.AxisGroup
member.summary: Returns the group for the specified axis. Read-only AxisGroup.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.AxisTitle
member.summary: Use the AxisTitle property to return an AxisTitle object. The following example activates embedded chart one, sets the value axis title text, sets the font to Bookman 10 point, and formats the word millions as italic.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.BaseUnitIsAuto
member.summary: True if Microsoft Excel chooses appropriate base units for the specified category axis. The default value is True. Read/write bool.
member.remarks: You cannot set this property for a value axis.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.Border
member.summary: Returns a Border object that represents the border of the object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.CategoryNames
member.summary: Returns or sets all the category names for the specified axis, as a text array. When you set this property, you can set it to either an array or a Range object that contains the category names. Read/write object.
member.remarks: Category names are really a property of the "special" series in an axis grouping. Deleting or modifying that special series will change the category names for all series using the axis.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.CategoryType
member.summary: Returns or sets the category axis type. Read/write CategoryType.
member.remarks: You cannot set this property for a value axis.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.Crosses
member.summary: Returns or sets the point on the specified axis where the other axis crosses. Read/write AxisCrosses. Can be one of the AxisCrosses constants listed in the following table.
member.remarks: This property isn't available for radar charts. For 3-D charts, this property indicates where the plane defined by the category axes crosses the value axis.This property can be used for both category and value axes. On the category axis, Minimum sets the value axis to cross at the first category, and Maximum sets the value axis to cross at the last category. Note that Minimum and Maximum can have different meanings, depending on the axis.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Axis.CrossesAt
member.summary: Returns or sets the point on the value axis where the category axis crosses it. Applies only to the value axis. Read/write double.
member.remarks: Setting this property causes the Crosses property to change to AxisCrossesCustom. This property cannot be used on radar charts. For 3-D charts, this property indicates where the plane defined by the category axes crosses the value axis.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Border

member.name: M:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Chart.Unprotect(System.String)
member.summary: Removes protection from a sheet or workbook. This method has no effect if the sheet or workbook isn't protected.
member.param: A string that denotes the case-sensitive password to use to unprotect the sheet or workbook. If the sheet or workbook isn't protected with a password, this argument is ignored. If you omit this argument for a sheet that's protected with a password, you'll be prompted for the password. If you omit this argument for a workbook that's protected with a password, the method fails.
member.remarks: If you forget the password, you cannot unprotect the sheet or workbook. It's a good idea to keep a list of your passwords and their corresponding document names in a safe place.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Chart.BubbleScale

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Chart.Overlap
member.summary: Specifies how bars and columns are positioned. Can be a value between � 100 and 100. Applies only to 2-D bar and 2-D column charts. Read/write long.
member.remarks: If this property is set to � 100, bars are positioned so that there's one bar width between them. If the overlap is 0 (zero), there's no space between bars (one bar starts immediately after the preceding bar). If the overlap is 100, bars are positioned on top of each other.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SharpCells.DownBars
member.summary: Represents the down bars in a chart group.
member.remarks: Down bars connect points on the first series in the chart group with lower values on the last series (the lines go down from the first series). Only 2-D line groups that contain at least two series can have down bars. This object isn�t a collection. There�s no object that represents a single down bar; you either have up bars and down bars turned on for all points in a chart group or you have them turned off.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SharpCells.DropLines
member.summary: Represents the drop lines in a chart group. Drop lines connect the points in the chart with the x-axis.
member.remarks: Only line and area chart groups can have drop lines. This object isn�t a collection. There�s no object that represents a single drop line; you either have drop lines turned on for all points in a chart group or you have them turned off.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Implementation.XfTable
member.summary:
XfTable may contain duplicate XF entries originally and we are not going to pack them, since they can be used from different locations. But we will preserve uniqueness for the later added entries.
Compacting the table before the save removes unused entries (since it can not effeciently merge duplicates those existed on reading).
For internal use only.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.SharpCells.MSApi.Range.Address(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,GrapeCity.SharpCells.ReferenceStyle,System.Boolean,GrapeCity.SharpCells.MSApi.Range)
member.summary: Returns the range reference in the language of the macro. Read-only.
member.param: true to return the row part of the reference as an absolute reference. The default value is true.
true to return the column part of the reference as an absolute reference. The default value is true.
Reference style. ReferenceStyle.A1 default. Use ReferenceStyle.A1 to return an A1-style reference. ReferenceStyle.R1C1 to return an R1C1-style reference.
true to return an external reference. false to return a local reference. The default value is false.

If rowAbsolute and columnAbsolute are false, and ReferenceStyle is ReferenceStyle.R1C1, you must include a starting point for the relative reference. This argument is a Range object that defines the starting point.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.MSApi.Range.AllowEdit
member.summary: true if the range can be edited on a protected worksheet. Read-only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.MSApi.Range.Areas
member.summary: Returns an Areas collection that represents all the ranges in a multiple-area selection. Read-only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.MSApi.Range.Borders
member.summary:
Returns a Borders collection that represents the borders of a range of cells (including a range defined
as part of a conditional format).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.MSApi.Range.Column
member.summary: Returns the number of the first column in the first area in the specified range. Read-only.
member.remarks:
Column A returns 1, column B returns 2, and so on. To return the number of the last column in the range, use the following expression.
myRange.Columns[myRange.Columns.Count].Column

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.MSApi.Range.ColumnWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the width of all columns in the specified range. Read/write.
member.remarks: One unit of column width is equal to the width of one character in the Normal style. For proportional fonts, the width of the character 0 (zero) is used. Use the Width property to return the width of a column in points. If all columns in the range have the same width, the ColumnWidth property returns the width. If columns in the range have different widths, this property returns Double.NaN.

member.summary: Returns a Range object that represents the columns in the specified range. Read-only.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup
member.summary: Represents the page setup description. The PageSetup object contains all page setup attributes (left margin, bottom margin, paper size, and so on) as properties. For internal use only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.BlackAndWhite
member.summary: true if elements of the document will be printed in black and white. Read/write bool.
member.remarks: This property applies only to worksheet pages.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.BottomMargin
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the bottom margin, in points. Read/write double.
member.remarks: Margins are set or returned in points. Use either the InchesToPoints method or the CentimetersToPoints method to do the conversion.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.CenterFooter
member.summary: Returns or sets the center part of the footer. Read/write string.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.CenterHeader
member.summary: Returns or sets the center part of the header. Read/write string.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.CenterHorizontally
member.summary: true if the sheet is centered horizontally on the page when it's printed. Read/write bool.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.CenterVertically
member.summary: true if the sheet is centered vertically on the page when it's printed. Read/write bool.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.Draft
member.summary: true if the sheet will be printed without graphics. Read/write bool.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true makes printing faster (at the expense of not printing graphics).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.FirstPageNumber
member.summary: Returns or sets the first page number that will be used when this sheet is printed. If Automatic, Microsoft Excel chooses the first page number. The default is Automatic. Read/write int.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.FitToPagesTall
member.summary: Returns or sets the number of pages tall the worksheet will be scaled to when it's printed. Applies only to worksheets. Read/write int.
member.remarks: If this property is false, Microsoft Excel scales the worksheet according to the FitToPagesWide property.If the Zoom property is true, the FitToPagesTall property is ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.FitToPagesWide
member.summary: Returns or sets the number of pages wide the worksheet will be scaled to when it's printed. Applies only to worksheets. Read/write int.
member.remarks: If this property is false, Microsoft Excel scales the worksheet according to the FitToPagesTall property.If the Zoom property is true, the FitToPagesWide property is ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.FooterMargin
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance from the bottom of the page to the footer, in points. Read/write double.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.HeaderMargin
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance from the top of the page to the header, in points. Read/write double.
member.remarks: Margins are set or returned in points. Use the InchesToPoints method or the CentimetersToPoints method to convert measurements from inches or centimeters

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.LeftFooter
member.summary: Returns or sets the left part of the footer. Read/write string.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.LeftHeader
member.summary: Returns or sets the left part of the header. Read/write string.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.LeftMargin
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the left margin, in points. Read/write double.
member.remarks: Margins are set or returned in points. Use the InchesToPoints method or the CentimetersToPoints method to convert measurements from inches or centimeters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.Order

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PageSetup.PaperSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the paper. Read/write PaperSize.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SharpCells.PlotArea
member.summary: Represents the plot area of a chart.
member.remarks: This is the area where your chart data is plotted. The plot area on a 2-D chart contains the data markers, gridlines, data labels, trendlines, and optional chart items placed in the chart area. The plot area on a 3-D chart contains all the above items plus the walls, floor, axes, axis titles, and tick-mark labels in the chart.

member.summary: Adds one or more new series to the SeriesCollection collection.
member.param: The new data, either as a Range object or an array of data points.
Specifies whether the new values are in the rows or columns of the specified range.

Ignored if Source is an array. true if the first row or column contains the name of the data series. false if the first row or column contains the first data point of the series. If this argument is omitted, Microsoft Excel attempts to determine the location of the series name from the contents of the first row or column.

true if the first row or column contains the name of the category labels. false if the first row or column contains the first data point of the series. If this argument is omitted, Microsoft Excel attempts to determine the location of the category label from the contents of the first row or column.

If CategoryLabels is true and Replace is true, the specified categories replace the categories that currently exist for the series. If Replace is false, the existing categories will not be replaced. The default value is false

member.remarks: Each Trendline object represents a trendline in a chart. A trendline shows the trend, or direction, of data in a series.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Trendlines.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of objects in the collection. Read-only long.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Trendlines.Add(GrapeCity.SharpCells.TrendlineType,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new trendline. Returns a Trendline object.
member.param: The trendline type.
Required if Type is Polynomial. The trendline order. Must be an integer from 2 to 6, inclusive.
Required if Type is xlMovingAvg. The trendline period. Must be an integer greater than 1 and less than the number of data points in the series you�re adding a trendline to
The number of periods (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends forward.
The number of periods (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends backward.
The trendline intercept. If this argument is omitted, the intercept is automatically set by the regression.
true to display the equation of the trendline on the chart (in the same data label as the R-squared value). The default value is false.
true to display the R-squared value of the trendline on the chart (in the same data label as the equation). The default value is false.
The name of the trendline as text. If this argument is omitted, Microsoft Excel generates a name.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SharpCells.UpBars
member.summary: Represents the up bars in a chart group.
member.remarks: Up bars connect points on series one with higher values on the last series in the chart group (the lines go up from series one). Only 2-D line groups that contain at least two series can have up bars. This object isn�t a collection. There�s no object that represents a single up bar; you either have up bars turned on for all points in a chart group or you have them turned off.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Window
member.summary: Represents a window.
member.remarks: Many worksheet characteristics, such as scroll bars and gridlines, are actually properties of the window. The Window object is a member of the Windows collection. The Windows collection for the Application object contains all the windows in the application, whereas the Windows collection for the Workbook object contains only the windows in the specified workbook.

member.summary: Protects a workbook so that it cannot be modified.
member.param: A string that specifies a case-sensitive password for the worksheet or workbook. If this argument is null or String.Empty, user can unprotect the worksheet or workbook without using a password. Otherwise, user must specify the password to unprotect the worksheet or workbook.
true to protect the structure of the workbook (the relative position of the sheets).
True to protect the workbook windows. If this argument is omitted, the windows aren�t protected.
member.example:
This example protects the workbook.
workbook.Protect( "password", true, true );

member.summary: Saves the workbook and protects it for sharing.
member.param: A string indicating the name of the saved file. You can include a full path; if you don�t, Microsoft Excel saves the file in the current folder.
A case-sensitive string indicating the protection password to be given to the file. Should be no longer than 15 characters.
A string indicating the write-reservation password for this file. If a file is saved with the password and the password isn�t supplied when the file is opened, the file is opened read-only.
true to display a message when the file is opened, recommending that the file be opened read-only.
true to create a backup file.
A string indicating the password to be used to protect the file for sharing.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Worksheet.Protect(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Protects a worksheet so that it cannot be modified.
member.param: A string that specifies a case-sensitive password for the worksheet or workbook. If this argument is omitted, you can unprotect the worksheet or workbook without using a password. Otherwise, you must specify the password to unprotect the worksheet or workbook. If you forget the password, you cannot unprotect the worksheet or workbook. It's a good idea to keep a list of your passwords and their corresponding document names in a safe place.
true to protect shapes. The default value is false.
true to protect contents. For a chart, this protects the entire chart. For a worksheet, this protects the locked cells. The default value is true.
True to protect scenarios. This argument is valid only for worksheets. The default value is True.
true to protect the user interface, but not macros. If this argument is omitted, protection applies both to macros and to the user interface.
true allows the user to format any cell on a protected worksheet. The default value is false.
true allows the user to format any column on a protected worksheet. The default value is false.
True allows the user to format any row on a protected. The default value is false.
true allows the user to insert columns on the protected worksheet. The default value is false.
true allows the user to insert rows on the protected worksheet. The default value is false.
true allows the user to insert hyperlinks on the worksheet. The default value is false.
true allows the user to delete columns on the protected worksheet, where every cell in the column to be deleted is unlocked. The default value is false.
true allows the user to delete rows on the protected worksheet, where every cell in the row to be deleted is unlocked. The default value is false.
true allows the user to sort on the protected worksheet. Every cell in the sort range must be unlocked or unprotected. The default value is false.

true allows the user to set filters on the protected worksheet. Users can change filter criteria but can not enable or disable an auto filter. Users can set filters on an existing auto filter. The default value is false.
true allows the user to use pivot table reports on the protected worksheet. The default value is false.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.SharpCells.Worksheet.Unprotect(System.String)
member.summary: Removes protection from a sheet or workbook. This method has no effect if the sheet or workbook isn't protected.
member.param: A string that denotes the case-sensitive password to use to unprotect the sheet or workbook. If the sheet or workbook isn't protected with a password, this argument is ignored. If you omit this argument for a sheet that's protected with a password, you'll be prompted for the password. If you omit this argument for a workbook that's protected with a password, the method fails.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Excel.DDR.Core.Serialization.XorObfuscator
member.summary: Several records (Password (section 2.4.191), FileSharing (section 2.4.118), Prot4RevPass (section 2.4.206), FeatProtection (section 2.5.124), and FilePass (section 2.4.117)) use a password verifier to provide a locking and unlocking system for viewing or editing parts of the workbook. This password verifier is used to prevent accidental editing, and is not designed to be used as a security feature.

member.param: A string indicates password.
member.returns: Get the hash code of the password.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Excel.OpenXmlTransitionalPatcher
member.summary: Patch the document according to the Transitional standard.
member.remarks: Refer to case 166868. The OpenXML sdk saves the document in Strict standard. The Google Docs (Google Drive) does not support Strict standard fully. So need convert some files in the document according to the Transitional standard. It does not convert the document to Transitional standard fully. Just make the necessary conversion to make Google Docs accept the document.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.SpreadBuilder.XORObfuscation
member.summary: Several records (Password (section 2.4.191), FileSharing (section 2.4.118), Prot4RevPass (section 2.4.206), FeatProtection (section 2.5.124), and FilePass (section 2.4.117)) use a password verifier to provide a locking and unlocking system for viewing or editing parts of the workbook. This password verifier is used to prevent accidental editing, and is not designed to be used as a security feature.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.SpreadBuilder.XORObfuscation.CreatePasswordVerifier1(System.String)
member.summary: This procedure specifies how a 16-bit password verifier is obtained from a password string. The password verifier is used in XOR obfuscation, as well as for document write protection.(the XOR obfuscation algorithm specified in [MS-OFFCRYPTO], 2.3.7.1, Binary Document Password Verifier Derivation Method 1)
member.param: A string indicates password.
member.returns: Get the hash code of the password.
